author: Dan O'Brien
comment: Nice to have more Fitbit notification options on my Zenwatch but all of the single bar widgets are missing the bottom 25% of the bar on my Note 3 so I can't see all of the info being tracked. May have to uninstall... when I run I need to be able to simply raise my Zenwatch & see my steps.  All I can see is "FitIt"... not convenient to use other hand. Also it's a bit of a kludge to only be able to reach the Settings window by tapping the main, rotating, multi-bar widget. Why not from the main "Install" icon?
title: Widget bars cut off on bottom.

author: Christian Natiez
comment: This app worked flawlessly for some months. Since last week it crashes permanently, every few seconds, leaving Android to state: "Unfortunately, FitIt Wear Pro for FitBit® has stopped." It's updated. So is the FitBit app, which shouldn't really matter anyway. I reconnected it to the FitBit webapp, giving the proper pin. It then actually displays correct data in the 4x2 widget. But it still keeps crashing. Using Samsung Galaxy S5 Android 4.4 and LG G watch Android 5.1.1.
title: Crashing

author: Noreen McCall
comment: I was interested in the ability of syncing my Flex to my watch but this software does not work. It crashes ever time it updates. Please rework.
title: Crashes constantly

author: Ray Burke
comment: So in order to see my current step count on my watch I have to open the app on my phone which then opens the official fitbit app which shows me my steps which updates the app which shows me my steps which then allows me to see my steps on my watch?????

reply.author: Mountain Edge Inc
reply.content: notification to watch should include the steps. No need to do what you described.

author: Glenn Wakefield
comment: Doesn't communicate with my watch and has a lot of "pop up" messages on my watch and phone.
title: Bad on Moto 360

author: Jeremy Rochon
comment: It used to work great.  Now it just force closes every time it opens
title: Force Close

author: Brandon Voytoski
comment: I really wanted to like this app. When it works it does everything I want in that it sends my Fitbit stats to my Asus Zenwatch. However, the app crashes constantly throughout the day on my Nexus 6, which has me uninstalling it until an update can address this issue.
title: Close, but no cigar

author: Shawna Gibson
comment: First launch it threw a "has stopped" report... so I tried to place the widget on my screen a second time and it threw the report a second time!!
title: No Good

author: E Warren
comment: Tried for a week and the sync never worked.
title: Not in sync
